div.p: This application was written as an experiment with NoJS client side programming using Michael Kay's/Saxonica's exciting product Saxon-JS.
The program attempts to solve a mastermind challenge by guessing four colours in the mind of the user.

The algorithm is not meant to be very clever - it is basically a matter of brute force backtracking in an attempt to find a new move that does not contradict earlier moves. In some situations, the calculation may cause a considerable delay, especially on slow systems.
The most important thing, however, is that no Javascript is used whatsoever (apart, of course, from the Javascript that was used to implement Saxon-JS!).
If you would like to have an easy look at the code, here's a zip. Note that you have to set up Saxon-JS yourself.
